Show / Hide Table of Contents

Class XQueryExpression

XQueryExpression represents a parsed XQuery expression, and is created by a call to Prepare(String, QueryContext).

Inheritance
System.Object
XQueryExpression
Implements
System.IDisposable
Inherited Members
System.Object.ToString()

System.Object.GetHashCode()
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public sealed class XQueryExpression : IDisposable
Remarks

Parsed XQuery expressions are useful because they allow the cost of query parsing and optimization to be amortized over many evaluations. If indices of a container that may be referenced by a parsed XQuery expression are modified (e.g. add/drop an index) the XQueryExpression object should be regenerated by the application.

This object is free threaded, and can be safely shared among threads in an application.

Remarks

XQuery must restrict the scope of this query using either the collection() or the doc() XQuery navigation functions, or an exception is thrown.
